fi.tuni.tamk

Class MiniGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tamk.MiniGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class MiniGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Minigame class handles the minigame questions and sets different variables in the Tower Of Life class according how player answers the questions.

    Minigame questions are divided into 3 different types. The type of question depends on which block has been dropped in the Tower Of Life class. The game is programmed so that the same question doesn't appear again until all the questions have been answered in the said category. The questions are answered by tapping the screen. The minigame has assigned touch areas in the screen that determine whether the answer is correct or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MiniGame

        public MiniGame(java.lang.String e,
                Main host)
        Constructor for the Minigame class. This constructor builds the ArrayLists for questions, determines which category of question is presented to the user and builds the touch areas for the Android screen so player can answer the questions by tapping the screen.
        Parameters:
        e - is a String value that determines which type of question will be presented to the player.
        host - is the Main object that handles the switching of screens between the Minigame and main game.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Mandatory method for classes implementing the screen. Renders all the Textures used in the minigame to the players screen.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - is the deltatime, or elapsed time.

      • choose

        public void choose()
        Method that creates a Vector3 touchpoint from the point the user touches at the screen. This touchpoint is then relayed to another method for checking whether the answer is correct (is the touchpoint within the determined "correct" area).

      • isAnswerRight

        public void isAnswerRight(int x,
                          int y)
        Method that determines whether the players answer is correct by using the Vector3 coordinates that are built in choose() method.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate of Vector3 that's created when user touches the screen.
        y - is the y coordinate of Vector3 that's created when user touches the screen.

      • getTextHeight

        public float getTextHeight(java.lang.String text)
        Method for centering the texts used in the questions to the middle of answerboxes.

        It takes String as a parameter and determines how many lines are needed for the said text.

        Parameters:
        text - is the text that is needed to be centered.
